column2: 1.  Operational Strategy:  Develop and implement operational strategies aligned with the company's overall mission, vision, and long-term goals. This includes defining operational objectives, establishing key performance indicators (KPIs), and monitoring progress towards targets. 2.  Project Management:  Oversee the planning, execution, and completion of renewable energy projects, including solar, wind, hydro, biomass, and energy storage installations. Ensure that projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the required quality standards. 3.  Resource Allocation:  Allocate resources effectively across projects, departments, and initiatives to optimize operational efficiency and achieve business objectives. This includes managing budgets, staffing levels, equipment, and other resources. 4.  Risk Management:  Identify, assess, and mitigate operational risks that may impact project delivery, financial performance, or regulatory compliance. Develop contingency plans and risk mitigation strategies to minimize disruptions and ensure business continuity. 5.  Quality Assurance and Control:  Establish and maintain quality assurance processes to ensure that renewable energy projects meet or exceed industry standards, regulatory requirements, and customer expectations. Implement quality control measures to monitor and improve project performance. 6.  Supply Chain Management:  Manage the supply chain for renewable energy projects, including procurement, logistics, and inventory management. Build strategic partnerships with suppliers, vendors, and contractors to ensure timely delivery of materials and services. 7.  Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE):  Promote a culture of safety and environmental stewardship across the organization. Implement HSE policies, procedures, and training programs to minimize workplace accidents, protect the environment, and ensure regulatory compliance. 8.  Technology and Innovation:  Drive innovation and continuous improvement in operational processes, technologies, and methodologies. Identify opportunities to leverage new technologies, automation, and digital solutions to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and increase competitiveness. 9.  Regulatory Compliance:  Ensure compliance with relevant regulations, permits, licenses, and environmental standards governing the renewable energy industry. Stay abreast of regulatory changes and emerging trends that may impact operations and business strategies. 10.  Stakeholder Engagement:  Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including government agencies, regulatory bodies, industry associations, community groups, and project partners. Collaborate with stakeholders to address concerns, resolve issues, and promote the benefits of renewable energy projects. 11.  Performance Monitoring and Reporting:  Establish systems and processes to monitor operational performance, analyze data, and generate actionable insights. Prepare regular reports and presentations for senior management, board members, investors, and other stakeholders. 12.  Talent Development:  Recruit, develop, and retain top talent within the organization. Provide leadership, mentorship, and professional development opportunities to build a high-performing team capable of delivering results and driving innovation.
column11: Operations Strategy, Business Operations, Operations, Operations Planning

column2: Role & responsibilities    Chief Operating Officer ( Auto-Ancillary)  Preferred candidate profile     - The Group is a diversified group, its automotive business spreads across leading auto-OEMs. One of the group company needs a COO for heading the business.   - Management has ambitious plans on anvil for growing the company thru aggressive acquisition of new business. The order book is quite healthy.   The position is based at Gurgaon and reports to Group MD. The KRAs for the position include: Managing expectations of all stakeholders including customers.   - Business strategy & planning   - P&L Management   - Plant Operations including New Projects & New Programs   - Supporting New Business Development- Overseas & Indian OEMs   - Logistics / Supply Chain Management   - Product Engineering & VE   - All Compliances etc.   - Work experience/competencies desired:   - Analytical, Problem solving, troubleshooting & planning expertise   - Team builder & high degree of ethics and integrity   - Top notch customer-centricity   - Very high business acumen   This is top management cadre position and offers excellent opportunities for horizontal & vertical career-growth. The compensation is negotiable. The incumbent needs to be a strategic planner as well as an astute executioner, 100% result-centric, highly matured & top notch on people management. This position forms part of strategic think-tank.   The incumbent needs to be from auto-ancillary sector Perks and benefits
